title: Joint Space Neural Probabilistic Language Model for Statistical Machine Translation
abstract: A neural probabilistic language model (NPLM) provide an idea to achieve the better perplexity than n-gram language model and their smoothed language models. This paper investigates application area in bilingual NLP, specifically Statistical Machine Translation (SMT). We focus on the perspectives that NPLM has potential to open the possibility to complement potentially `huge' monolingual resources into the `resource-constraint' bilingual resources. In order to facilitate the application to various tasks, we propose the joint space model of ngram-HMM language model. We show two experiments in SMT: system combination and word alignment.
